DOC.brief_summary: The ability to metabolize drugs varies greatly among individuals. Major fraction of this variability lies in genetic polymorphisms of genes encoding for enzymes responsible for both phase I and phase II reactions. The purpose of this study ws to evaluate the phenotypic activity and the frequency of genetic polymorphisms in different phase II and phase I enzymes among various populations residing in Israel.
DOC.criteria: Age range 2050 Absence of significant disease state The presence of significant disease states The regular use of drugs (including birth control pills)
